alert.note: Alert for Macomb; St. Clair (Michigan) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued July 13 at 3:02AM EDT by NWS Detroit
info.description: ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT UNTIL 515 AM EDT EARLY THIS MORNING... ...REPLACES FLOOD ADVISORY... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of southeast Michigan, including the following counties, Macomb and St. Clair. * WHEN...Until 515 AM EDT. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 258 AM EDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Flooding is already occurring in the warned area. Between 2.0 and 4 inches of rain have fallen. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Port Huron, Richmond, Romeo, Yale, Capac, Lakeport, Marysville, Armada, Memphis, Emmett, New Haven, Brockway, Washington, Blaine, Columbus, Riley Center, Goodells, Berville, Avoca and Smiths Creek. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding.
